meanings.definition: To cut or shape wood with a knife
meanings.sent1: He carefully whittles a small boat out of a piece of wood.
meanings.sent2: She whittles a wooden spoon during her free time.
meanings.sent3: The old man whittles a funny face into the stick, making it look like a person.
meanings.sent4: She whittles away at the block of wood, slowly revealing the intricate design within.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the knife against the wood as he whittles fills the room.

meanings.definition: Small pieces or shavings of wood
meanings.sent1: He collected the whittles from the floor to use as kindling for the fire.
meanings.sent2: The craftsman used the tiny whittles to decorate the wooden frame.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel gathered the whittles to build a cozy nest in the tree.
meanings.sent4: The whittles scattered on the ground looked like confetti after the celebration.
meanings.sent5: The box was filled with colorful whittles of different types of wood.

meanings.definition: To reduce or pare down gradually
meanings.sent1: She whittles down her to-do list by completing one task at a time.
meanings.sent2: The chef whittles the ingredients down to create a simple yet delicious dish.
meanings.sent3: He whittles away at his collection of books, donating some to the library.
meanings.sent4: The artist whittles away unnecessary details to reveal the essence of the painting.
meanings.sent5: Time seems to whittle away at the memories, leaving only the most vivid ones behind.
